items.name: aiohttp
items.recommendation: keep
items.gratitude: Thank you for enabling concurrent API scraping across 4 federal data sources.

items.name: pydantic
items.recommendation: keep
items.gratitude: Thank you for providing structured validation for congressional intelligence models.

items.name: python-dateutil
items.recommendation: keep
items.gratitude: Thank you for flexible date parsing across inconsistent federal API date formats.

items.name: jinja2
items.recommendation: keep
items.gratitude: Thank you for templating the markdown briefing reports.

items.name: rapidfuzz
items.recommendation: keep
items.gratitude: Thank you for enabling 85% fuzzy matching threshold for Tribal name resolution across 592 Nations.

items.name: pyyaml
items.recommendation: evaluate -- used only in monitor base class for YAML config parsing; could use json if config files were converted
items.gratitude: Thank you for readable monitor configuration. You served well during Phase 4.

items.name: python-docx
items.recommendation: keep
items.gratitude: Thank you for generating 992 DOCX advocacy packets that serve 592 Tribal Nations.

items.name: openpyxl
items.recommendation: keep
items.gratitude: Thank you for Excel report generation in the reporting pipeline.

items.name: requests
items.recommendation: evaluate -- used only in two download scripts; the main pipeline uses aiohttp exclusively. Could use urllib.request for simple GET downloads to eliminate the dependency
items.gratitude: Thank you for simple synchronous downloads of NRI and USFS data files.

items.name: geopandas
items.recommendation: keep -- build-time dependency for geographic area calculations
items.gratitude: Thank you for enabling AIANNH-to-county area weight calculations.

items.name: shapely
items.recommendation: keep -- transitive dependency of geopandas
items.gratitude: Thank you for geometric intersection calculations.

items.name: pyproj
items.recommendation: keep -- transitive dependency of geopandas
items.gratitude: Thank you for coordinate reference system transformations.

items.name: pyogrio
items.recommendation: keep -- fast I/O backend for geopandas
items.gratitude: Thank you for fast reading of shapefiles.

items.name: scripts/_add_curated_aliases_round3.py
items.recommendation: remove -- one-time migration script, already applied
items.gratitude: Thank you for adding the third round of curated Tribal aliases. Your work lives on in data/tribal_aliases.json.

items.name: scripts/_add_curated_aliases_round4.py
items.recommendation: remove -- one-time migration script, already applied
items.gratitude: Thank you for the fourth round of alias curation.

items.name: scripts/_add_curated_aliases_round5.py
items.recommendation: remove -- one-time migration script, already applied
items.gratitude: Thank you for the fifth and final round of alias refinement.

items.name: scripts/_add_curated_aliases_tmp.py
items.recommendation: remove -- temporary script, no longer needed
items.gratitude: Thank you for your temporary service during alias development.

items.name: CFDA_TO_PROGRAM duplication
items.recommendation: refactor -- CFDA_NUMBERS dict in grants_gov.py and CFDA_TO_PROGRAM dict in usaspending.py are near-duplicates (12 of 14 entries overlap). Consider extracting to a shared module (e.g., src/scrapers/cfda_map.py)
items.gratitude: Thank you both for independently tracking CFDA numbers. It is time to consolidate.

items.name: TRIBAL_AWARD_TYPE_CODES flat list
items.recommendation: evaluate -- TRIBAL_AWARD_TYPE_CODES (flat list) exists alongside TRIBAL_AWARD_TYPE_CODE_GROUPS (nested list). The flat list is documented as 'backward compatibility' but no external code imports it. Could be derived: [code for group in GROUPS for code in group]
items.gratitude: Thank you for documenting the award type taxonomy. The flat list may still serve external reference.

items.name: docs/web/404.html
items.recommendation: keep -- SPA routing fallback for GitHub Pages
items.gratitude: Thank you for handling deep link navigation on GitHub Pages.

items.name: Unused import check: asyncio in congress_gov.py
items.recommendation: keep -- asyncio.sleep is used for rate limiting between API calls
items.gratitude: Thank you for rate-limiting API requests to be a good citizen.

items.name: Re-exported PROJECT_ROOT in config.py
items.recommendation: evaluate -- config.py re-exports PROJECT_ROOT from paths.py via __all__. This creates an import alias: both src.config.PROJECT_ROOT and src.paths.PROJECT_ROOT resolve to the same value. The re-export exists for backward compatibility with older code that imported from config. New code should import from paths directly.
items.gratitude: Thank you for maintaining backward compatibility. But we should gradually migrate imports.

items.name: pyyaml import
items.recommendation: evaluate -- pyyaml is imported in only 1 file. Monitor configs could be JSON instead of YAML to eliminate this dependency. Low priority since pyyaml is lightweight.
items.gratitude: Thank you for readable YAML configuration in the monitor framework.

items.name: requests import
items.recommendation: evaluate -- requests is used only in 2 download scripts for simple synchronous GET requests. urllib.request from stdlib could replace it. Low priority since requests is widely installed.
items.gratitude: Thank you for reliable HTTP downloads of NRI and USFS data.

items.name: Workflow step duplication
items.recommendation: note -- manifest.json generation code is duplicated between two workflows (~20 identical lines). Could extract to a shared script. Acceptable for CI readability per SYNTHESIS.md.
items.gratitude: Thank you for clear, self-contained workflow definitions.

items.name: docs/web/data/ directory
items.recommendation: keep -- contains tribes.json (search index) and manifest.json (deployment metadata)
items.gratitude: Thank you for organizing web data in a dedicated directory.

items.name: docs/web/tribes/ directory
items.recommendation: keep -- contains DOCX files organized by type (internal/, congressional/, regional/)
items.gratitude: Thank you for organizing documents by audience.

items.name: .planning/ directory
items.recommendation: keep -- active planning and state tracking for GSD workflow
items.gratitude: Thank you for structured milestone planning that brought this project from 0 to 964 tests.

joy_analysis: This codebase sparks significant joy. 47 Python source files, 32 test files, ~37,900 LOC -- everything has a purpose. The architecture is clean: scrapers, analysis, graph, monitors, packets, reports. Each module owns its domain. The web frontend is 4 files totaling ~67KB. The only clutter: 4 one-time alias migration scripts (prefixed with _) that have completed their purpose and can be released with gratitude. The CFDA duplication between scrapers is a minor consolidation opportunity. After tidying: 9/10 joy -- a codebase that serves 592 Tribal Nations with exactly what they need and nothing more.
